xxl.core.relational.tuples
Class TupleConverter

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<Tuple>
      xxl.core.relational.tuples.TupleConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class TupleConverter
extends Converter<Tuple>

This class is a converter for tuples which converts a tuple into a byte value in order to read or write a tuple.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

TupleConverter

public TupleConverter(Function<java.lang.Object,? extends Tuple> createResTuple,
                      boolean considerNullValues,
                      Converter<java.lang.Object>... converters)
Creates a new converter for tuples using the given converters to read and write the column values of tuples and the specified function for creating tuples by using these column values.

Parameters:
createResTuple - a function that maps a list of objects (column values) to a new result tuple. The factory methods of the tuple default implementations ArrayTuple and ListTuple can be used for this task. If null is passed, the constructor will try to determine the type of tuple that is used in the cursor. If it is possible, the appropriate factory method is used. If it is not possible, ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD is used.
considerNullValues - determines whether the converter should consider null values or not. If it is set to true a boolean converter is used to convert the information whether the value is null or not. When the value is not null the converted value follows. If it is set to false the specified converters must deal with null values.
converters - an array of converters used for converting the column values of the tuple to be converted.

TupleConverter

public TupleConverter(Function<java.lang.Object,? extends Tuple> createResTuple,
                      boolean considerNullValues,
                      java.sql.ResultSetMetaData metadata)
Creates a new converter for tuples using the given result set metadata for retrieving converters to read and write the column values of tuples and the specified function for creating tuples by using these column values.

Parameters:
createResTuple - a function that maps a list of objects (column values) to a new result tuple. The factory methods of the tuple default implementations ArrayTuple and ListTuple can be used for this task. If null is passed, the constructor will try to determine the type of tuple that is used in the cursor. If it is possible, the appropriate factory method is used. If it is not possible, ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD is used.
considerNullValues - determines whether the converter should consider null values or not. If it is set to true a boolean converter is used to convert the information whether the value is null or not. When the value is not null the converted value follows. If it is set to false the specified converters must deal with null values.
metadata - the result set metadata is used to retrieve converters for reading and writing the column values of tuples.

TupleConverter

public TupleConverter(boolean considerNullValues,
                      Converter<java.lang.Object>... converters)
Creates a new converter for tuples using the given converters to read and write the column values of tuples. The converter's read method returns array tuples generated by the factory method located in the class ArrayTuple.

Parameters:
considerNullValues - determines whether the converter should consider null values or not. If it is set to true a boolean converter is used to convert the information whether the value is null or not. When the value is not null the converted value follows. If it is set to false the specified converters must deal with null values.
converters - an array of converters used for converting the column values of the tuple to be converted.

TupleConverter

public TupleConverter(boolean considerNullValues,
                      java.sql.ResultSetMetaData metadata)
Creates a new converter for tuples using the given result set metadata for retrieving converters to read and write the column values of tuples. The converter's read method returns array tuples generated by the factory method located in the class ArrayTuple.

Parameters:
considerNullValues - determines whether the converter should consider null values or not. If it is set to true a boolean converter is used to convert the information whether the value is null or not. When the value is not null the converted value follows. If it is set to false the specified converters must deal with null values.
metadata - the result set metadata is used to retrieve converters for reading and writing the column values of tuples.

setConverter

public void setConverter(int index,
                         Converter<java.lang.Object> converter)
                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Sets a converter for the specified column of the tuple.

Parameters:
index - the number of the column whose values should be converter by the given converter.
converter - the converter used for reading and writing the values of the specified column.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given column number less than 1.

getConverter

public Converter<java.lang.Object> getConverter(int index)
                                         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Returns the converter used for converting the values of the specified column.

Parameters:
index - the number of the column whose data is converter by the given converter.
Returns:
the converter used for converting the values of the specified column.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given column number less than 1 or greater than the number of registered converters.

                  Tuple tuple)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the byte value of a tuple to the specified data output stream.

Specified by:
write in class Converter<Tuple>
Parameters:

java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

read

public Tuple read(java.io.DataInput input,
                  Tuple tuple)
           throws java.io.IOException
Reads the tuple from the data input stream.

Specified by:
read in class Converter<Tuple>
Parameters:
input - the input stream containing the contents of a tuple.
tuple - the tuple to be restored. This implementation ignores the given tuple.
Returns:
the tuple read from the data input stream.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
